content:
It sounds like you and Alex have a regular tennis routine going on! That's awesome. Consistency is key to improving your game, and playing with a regular partner can help you build chemistry and develop strategies together.

Given that you're familiar with the court, you can focus more on your game plan and strategy against Alex. Since you've been playing together for 6 weeks, you probably have a good sense of each other's strengths and weaknesses.

Here's an additional tip: try to mix up your game and throw in some surprises to keep Alex guessing. You might try hitting some different types of shots, such as a slice or a topspin forehand, or experiment with different angles and depths. This can help keep the match interesting and challenging for both of you.

Also, don't forget to stay flexible and adapt to the situation. If something's not working, be willing to adjust your strategy and try something new. And most importantly, remember to have fun and enjoy the game!

How's your game been progressing overall? Have you noticed any improvements or areas where you're still struggling?
